content: a crafters welcome to part two of our open abode or video today we're going to
paint the door and do the finishing details ie the door handle so let's go
to table and we'll finish those doors up so hey guys I got my door and it's
painted they've been spray painted black then I painted over that with a burnt
umber so it gave a kind of nice weathered look okay so I'm going to do a
little bit of highlight on this now and see look at that opens in that awesome
okay so I have got a moccasin Brown which is lighter brown and I've got kind
of a bristly a bristly brush okay so I'm going to drag that into my not
too much paint I don't want to totally load up the brush almost like a dry
brush technique and then I will start dragging the brush like this so very
similar to what I did on the table and see those supports on the top of the
door are coming out so then you just do the same thing with the door just pull
up the door get it enough see yeah and see that's really bringing a nice
kind of wooden texture and on that door just a nice simulation so then just you
know paint the base the sides and there you go that's it so we'll let that dry
and work on it to do a little more detail on it now this door is fine just
the way it is but I'm going to add a little more detail okay so make sure
also when you paint this that you paint the edging of the door okay so look how
great that looks that really looks good you could just leave that exactly how it
is you want to do this step okay so now for the next part I'm going to use a
thinner brush and I'm going to wet down my black okay put this over here so
popping in front of camera okay so I wet down the black and then you can just
trace along the edges there and it's going to look a little darker to start
okay and you can do the top all right so you get kind of a different ation there
or that just shows up so you can also do these side support beams here let's see
how that makes us pop out a little bit this is not something you have to do but
you could you could also kind of try to pick out the beams on the door if you
want like I say not required and then we're going to want to get that door
apart there all right see so you can see that pick that out some now that will
dry a bit and it'll it's wet right now it'll get a little lighter okay it's a
little it seems a little darker on camera but it'll get a little lighter so
you just do both sides and your and you're done to finish up the door on you
the door handle and so I I tried several different options I cut a piece of small
toothpick and put it on each side I tried some small pewter beads very small
peter beads and applied those to the handle I also use some small jewelry
links I got these at the craft store so you can see how small they are there
next to a toothpick there and I cut a bit of thin card stock and this will
help me attach it to the door so I just pulled that thin piece of card stock
through the loop and that's how I'll attach it to the door by gluing that
card stock piece to the handle area of the door I cut half an inch strips on
magnetic sheet and I'm going to glue them to the bottom of the door now the
the strips have self adhesive but I find that you need to accentuate that with
the strength so I use the white glue to glue those strips on the bottom of the
door and then I repeat the process for gluing them in the doorways now I've
noticed that on these magnetic sheets sometimes depending on how you align the
magnets they can stick better or worse or not stick at all so make sure that
you check the adhesion of the magnets together before you glue anything down
my last task was just to blend the magnetic strip into the tile itself so I
just use some dark brown on that and then use the same light brown I use to
accentuate the floorboards in the cardboard corrugation to blend it in
here we have our nice little hovel and the first store I'll show you is the one
with the we use the toothpick for the the door handle there we go and opens up
nicely and we have the magnet on there so that
helps keep it secured to the tile our next one is the one we use the bead for
the door handle and that just fits right on there and then opens right up like
that oh yeah there's our second door and the third one we use that link for and
here it is so do the nice effect and then it opens up the same way as the
other door so there we go some different styles of doors you could do for these
opening doors and there we go see you next time on the craft hey crafters I
hope you found this video also make sure you check out our
resources we have a Facebook page a growing Facebook page and that link is

a lot of members who post some great ideas and are happy to answer questions
so make sure to check it out oh here we are nameless rogue elf friend yes we
